did.abstract: This collection inculdes John G. Stephenson's patent for the first streetcar, developed in 1831. Stephenson (1809-1893) invented and patented the first streetcar that ran on rails in the United States.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; John G. Stephenson Streetcar Patent; MC 106; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2018 are unknown. In 2019 materials were tretated for mold and rehoused by Preservation, and sent to offsite storage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include original and reproductions of John G. Stephenson's patent documents for the first streetcar, developed in 1831.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John G. Stephenson (1809-1893) invented and patented the first streetcar that ran on rails in the United States. Stephenson was born in Ireland and emigrated to the United States with his parents in 1811.
